Name: Baghdad
Description: The capital city and largest city of Iraq, known for its rich history, cultural heritage, and significant political and economic importance.

Name: Basra
Description: A major port city in southern Iraq, known for its oil industry, trade, and historical significance.

Name: Erbil
Description: The capital of the Kurdistan Region of Iraq, known for its ancient history, the Erbil Citadel, and its thriving economy.

Name: Mosul
Description: A historically important city in northern Iraq, known for its rich cultural and architectural history, as well as its recent struggles during conflicts.

Name: Sulaymaniyah
Description: A city in the Kurdistan Region of Iraq, known for its scenic mountain landscapes, culture, and history.

Name: Najaf
Description: A city in southern Iraq, considered one of the holiest cities for Shia Muslims, known for the shrine of Imam Ali.

Name: Karbala
Description: A city in central Iraq, known for its religious significance and the location of the Battle of Karbala, which holds great importance for Shia Muslims.

Name: Dohuk
Description: A city in the Kurdistan Region of Iraq, known for its natural beauty, including mountains and rivers.

Name: Anbar
Description: A large province in western Iraq, known for its desert landscape and strategic military significance.

Name: Nineveh
Description: A province in northern Iraq, home to the ancient Assyrian city of Nineveh, and modern-day Mosul.

Name: Dhi Qar
Description: A southern province in Iraq, known for its archaeological sites, including the ancient Sumerian city of Ur.

Name: Babil
Description: A central province, home to the ancient city of Babylon, one of the most famous archaeological sites in the world.

Name: Salah ad Din
Description: A province in northern Iraq, known for its historical significance and as the location of the former Iraqi stronghold of Tikrit.

Name: Muthanna
Description: A province in southern Iraq, known for its agricultural resources and desert landscapes.

Name: Wasit
Description: A province in eastern Iraq, known for its fertile plains and proximity to the Tigris River.

Name: Kirkuk
Description: A city in northern Iraq, known for its strategic location and its importance as a center of the oil industry.

Name: Al-Qadisiyyah
Description: A province in central Iraq, known for its historical sites and important role during the Iran-Iraq War.
